title: 114_s2125
content: The Act titled "Small Business Lending and Economic Inequality Reduction Act of 2015" includes a section on the Community Advantage Program. The Small Business Act is amended to include a Community Advantage Program for eligible institutions like development companies and nonprofit intermediaries. The Small Business Act is amended to include a Community Advantage Program for eligible institutions such as nonprofit intermediaries, community development financial institutions, and other approved nonprofit organizations. The Small Business Act is amended to include the Community Advantage Program for eligible institutions, with defined terms such as Reservist and service-connected. An underserved market refers to a small business located in a low- or moderate-income community, a HUBZone, or a designated empowerment zone with over 50% of employees residing in a low- or moderate-income community. The Community Advantage Program under subparagraph (B) provides loans to small businesses meeting specific criteria, including being owned and controlled by veterans or service-disabled veterans. The Community Advantage Program provides loans to small businesses owned and controlled by veterans, reservists, spouses of veterans or reservists, and surviving spouses of veterans who died on active duty. The Community Advantage Program guarantees loans for small businesses in underserved markets, with a maximum loan amount of $350,000. The maximum loan amount under the program is $350,000. The Administrator will promulgate regulations within 1 year to carry out the program, similar to the Community Advantage Pilot Program. The Administrator may not carry out the Community Advantage Pilot Program of the Administration. Section 3(r) of the Small Business Act is amended to exclude covered institutions from the definition of a business concern. The Small Business Act is amended to exclude covered institutions from the definition of a business concern. Subparagraphs are redesignated and margins adjusted accordingly. SEC. 3 of the Federal Home Loan Bank Act is amended to include community development financial institutions in the purposes of advances and collateral available.
